text:
(1) Broadway, west side, north from and including East 18th Street to Madison Square, showing the retail dry goods area of this date. W. Arnold, Constable and Company and Lord and Taylor are occupying the S.W. corners of East 19th and 20th Streets respectively. These, including Thomas Lotan (fruit store) appear in Gouldings Business Directory of New York, 1875.

About 1875.

Gift of H.D. Jewett.

(2) Broadway, the same, showing W.P.A. reconstruction work.

August 10th, 1937

W.P.A. Photography.

(1) Broadway, west side, north from and including East 18th Street to Madison Square, showing the retail dry goods area of this date. W. Arnold, Constable and Company and Lord and Taylor are occupying the S.W. corners of East 19th and 20th Streets respectively. These, including Thomas Lotan (fruit store) appear in Gouldings Business Directory of New York, 1875.

About 1875.

Gift of H.D. Jewett.

(2) Broadway, the same, showing W.P.A. reconstruction work.

August 10th, 1937

W.P.A. Photography.

(1) Communist Demonstration: A semi-humorous reminder of former gatherings at this focal point of free thought.

May 1, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A northeast view from Union Square West (Broadway) and 18th Street showing the masses in front of the reviewing stand. Buildings shown are on the north side of 17th Street between Broadway and Fourth Ave.

May 1, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal Events - Communist Demonstration.
